questions.question_text:
A small company, with limited resources, has started to use Marketing Cloud. They have a single master data extension for all of their subscribers. When a subscriber opts in to receive communications, they will receive a monthly newsletter, weekly promotions, and a birthday email.
What is the optimal way to manage unsubscribes by communication type?

choices.C: Create publication lists for each communication type, and associate the publication list on the send definition.
choices.D: Create separate data extensions for each communication type and customize the subscription page.
choices.A: Create suppression lists for each communication type, and associate the suppression list on the send definition.
choices.B: Create a Boolean field for each communication type in the data extension and update the Profile Center.

discussion.content:
Option C-
Publication lists help you manage subscribers' unsubscribe or opt-out actions. Having a separate publication list for each communication type enables you to honor an opt-out request from one publication type without unsubscribing that person from all previously subscribed-to publications. If you use only one publication list for all of a subscriber's communications and if that person opts out of one publication, that subscriber will be opted out automatically from all publications.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_es_publication_lists.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters receives nightly files from its data warehouse to maintain opt-out compliance across multiple marketing platforms. These files contain only the previous days opt-out updates. If a run fails, it must be manually rerun to maintain compliance.

How should the notification be received if the data import is unsuccessful?

choices.C: Replicate the automation and schedule them to execute every eight hours.
choices.B: Replace the Schedule with File Drop and use a filename pattern.
choices.A: Implement an API to start an automation with every file transfer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer is B (real-time efficient processing with file drop). ( A is too complex and C is redundant work, why would you want to create ANOTHER automation and call it efficient?)

Selected Answer: B
To process the files as they are received while minimizing rework, Northern Trail Outfitters should:
• B. Replace the Schedule with File Drop and use a filename pattern.
Using a File Drop automation with a filename pattern allows the automation to trigger whenever a new file matching the pattern is dropped into the SFTP. This approach ensures that each file is processed as soon as it is received, without the need for manual intervention or scheduling multiple automations.

Selected Answer: C
The schedule needs to change from daily to 8 hours as its known. File drop is for times when the schedule is not known and is random. So answer is C and not B.

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters historically received a bulk data file from a vendor once per day in its Marketing Cloud SFTP. The vendor is updating its sending cadence and will be delivering files over approximately eight hours throughout the day. The files will maintain the same naming convention and include a timestamp.

Which update should be implemented to the automation to process the files as they are received while minimizing rework?

choices.B: Leverage Social Studio to capture email addresses.
choices.C: Use Journey Builder to build an audience using Ad Studio.
choices.A: Create CloudPages to collect and subscribe users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Social studio is already deprecated and should not be used. A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: A
Answer A. Cloud pages. CloudPages is a tool within Salesforce Marketing Cloud that allows marketers to create web pages, landing pages, and forms. These pages can be shared on social media channels to collect consumer information, such as email addresses. 

Social Studio is a tool within the Salesforce Marketing Cloud suite that focuses on social media listening, publishing, and engagement. While it's great for understanding and engaging with your audience on social media, it doesn't inherently capture email addresses from users.

Northern Trail Outfitters is redesigning its brand guidelines and wants to ensure its emails are accessible.

Which best practice should the email designer follow to meet accessibility standards?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To ensure emails are accessible, the email designer should follow this best practice:
• C. Use contrasting colors.
Using contrasting colors helps ensure that text is readable for individuals with visual impairments, including those with color blindness. This is a key aspect of accessibility standards and helps make content more accessible to a wider audience.
